c74object.name: th.yafr.freeze~
c74object.description: A modification on the classic yafr2 by Randy Jones. The abstraction gives simplified acces to a quick reverb by adding the attributes @preset and @wet on instantiation of the object. These can also be set with messages. All parameters can be changed on the inlet and range from 0 - 1 (but are not bound to that value, roomsize and decay can be larger). Parameters can also be set as a list with the params argument. An additional time domain pitchshift effect and fft-freezer is included in the delay-feedback to create a glissando effect and make the reverb freeze frames.

method.name: bang
method.description: inlet 1: input a 1 or a bang to start the fft-freeze. input a 0 to stop the fft-freeze. Additional bangs or ones take new freeze frames.

method.name: int
method.description: inlet 1: input a 1 or a bang to start the fft-freeze. input a 0 to stop the fft-freeze. Additional bangs or ones take new freeze frames.

method.name: signal
method.description:
inlet 1: The left input of the stereo signal.
inlet 2: The right input of the stereo signal.
inlet 3: Set the roomsize. Classic yafr2 between 0 - 1. Higher values result in bigger delays.
inlet 4: Set the decaytime. Classic yafr2 between 0 - 1. Higher values result in positive feedback with softclipping to reduce gain.
inlet 5: Set the damping. Values between 0 - 1 result in 100 - 15000 Hz with a logarithmic scaling.
inlet 6: Set the diffusion. Values between 0 - 1.
inlet 7: Set the gain for the early reflections. Values betewen 0 - 1.
inlet 8: Set the pitch shift ratio for shifting the reverb in the time-domain.

method.name: float
method.description:
inlet 3: Set the roomsize. Classic yafr2 between 0 - 1. Higher values result in bigger delays.
inlet 4: Set the decaytime. Classic yafr2 between 0 - 1. Higher values result in positive feedback with softclipping to reduce gain.
inlet 5: Set the damping. Values between 0 - 1 result in 100 - 15000 Hz with a logarithmic scaling.
inlet 6: Set the diffusion. Values between 0 - 1.
inlet 7: Set the gain for the early reflections. Values between 0 - 1.

method.name: params
method.digest: Set all the reverb parameters as a list on the first inlet.
method.description:
Set all the reverb parameters as a list on the first inlet.
Order of parameters in the list is: roomsize, decaytime, damping, diffusion, early-reflections gain.

attribute.name: wet
attribute.digest: The amount of reverb versus the amount of dry signal. (default = 1)
attribute.description: The wet-dry ratio of the reverb. 1 = 100% wet, 0 = 0% wet. (default = 1)

attribute.name: preset
attribute.digest: Choose a preset from the predefined reverb parameters.
attribute.description: Choose a preset from the predefined set of reverb parameters. 0 is a small room, and for every integer the parameters gradually increase. (default = 7)

attribute.name: slide
attribute.digest: Slide time in ms for linear smoothing between paramater changes (default = 10)
attribute.description: Slide time in ms for linear smoothing between paramater changes (default = 10)

attribute.name: shift
attribute.description: The shift ratio for the pitchshifter build in the delay-network. A ratio of 1 = no shift. A ratio of 2 = shift up one octave. A ratio of 0.5 = shift down one octave.

attribute.name: frames
attribute.digest: The number of fft frames for the freeze.
attribute.description: Amount of fft frames to be stored for the freeze. These frames will be outputted as a 4 plane matrix float32 out the third outlet. 2 planes for the left channel and 2 planes for the right channel. 1 plane is for amplitude, 1 plane for phase.

attribute.name: smooth
attribute.digest: Amount of frames to linear interpolate between.
attribute.description: The amount of frames to interpolate between when a new freeze frame is taken of the sound.
